scene_description_enriched: The scene depicts a headless saint, adorned in a blue chasuble with gold fleur-de-lis patterns and a mitre, being presented with his own severed head by a woman in a purple gown. An angel, with golden wings and wearing a red tunic, stands to the left, supporting the saint's body. Another figure, possibly a cleric or attendant, stands behind the saint. The background features stylized buildings with red roofs and white walls, suggesting an urban or ecclesiastical setting. This iconography represents the martyrdom of a saint, specifically one who was beheaded, and the miraculous presentation of their head.
